p.s: The article Language learning in the UK: can't, won't, don't, which is written by John Worne and published in The Telegraph on 27 January 2015, is about the fall of learning foreign languages in the UK and the personal view of the author on this issue.

John Worne says, that more and more students doesn'tdon't want to study any foreign language skills at university level and also the national view is that foreign language skills aren't that important today.
Also the exam results at national schools show, that the uptake of languages areis coming to a standstill.

But against, what other people say, that everyone can speak English in the world of working and business, Worne thinks that Britainsthe British need to learn other languages for the future perspective and global standing of the UK.
He also thinks, that learning foreign language skills, helphelps the UK businesses to establish in the global market.
Moreover John Worne says, that people with other language skills easier getting a job in the market, than one who only speaks English.
To conclude he says that the education system has to fix, so young people can develop their language skills, but for this it needneeds the help of the parents.
To sum it up you can say, that John Worne thinks, that learning foreign languages is important for the global future of the UK and this issue has to fix in the education system.
